bulbasaur1: There is a plant seed on its back right from the day this Pokémon is born. The seed slowly grows larger.

bulbasaur2: While it is young, it uses the nutrients that are stored in the seed on its back in order to grow.

ivysaur1: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

ivysaur2: Exposure to sunlight adds to its strength. Sunlight also makes the bud on its back grow larger.

venusaur1: Its plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

venusaur2: A bewitching aroma wafts from its flower. The fragrance becalms those engaged in a battle.

charmander1: It has a preference for hot things. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

charmander2: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.

charmeleon: It has a barbaric nature. In battle, it whips its fiery tail around and slashes away with sharp claws.

charmeleon2: If it becomes agitated during battle, it spouts intense flames, incinerating its surroundings.

charizard1: It spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. It may cause forest fires by blowing flames.

charizard2: Its wings can carry this Pokémon close to an altitude of 4,600 feet. It blows out fire at very high temperatures.

squirtle1: When it retracts its long neck into its shell, it squirts out water with vigorous force.

squirtle2: When it feels threatened, it draws its limbs inside its shell and sprays water from its mouth.

wartortle1: It is recognized as a symbol of longevity. If its shell has algae on it, that Wartortle is very old.

wartortle2: It cleverly controls its furry ears and tail to maintain its balance while swimming.

blastoise1: It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.

blastoise2: The rocket cannons on its shell fire jets of water capable of punching holes through thick steel.

caterpie1: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antenna on its head to drive away enemies.
Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

metapod1: It is waiting for the moment to evolve. At this stage, it can only harden, so it remains motionless to avoid attack.

metapod2: Even though it is encased in a sturdy shell, the body inside is tender. It can’t withstand a harsh attack.

butterfree1: In battle, it flaps its wings at great speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.

butterfree2: it collects honey every day. It rubs honey onto the hairs on its legs to carry it back to its nest.

weedle1: Beware of the sharp stinger on its head. It hides in grass and bushes where it eats leaves.

kakuna1: Able to move only slightly. When endangered, it may stick out its stinger and poison its enemy.

beedrill1: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.

pidgey1: Very docile. If attacked, it will often kick up sand to protect itself rather than fight back.

pidgeotto1: This Pokémon is full of vitality. It constantly flies around its large territory in search of prey.

pidgeot1: This Pokémon flies at Mach 2 speed, seeking prey. Its large talons are feared as wicked weapons.

rattata1: Will chew on anything with its fangs. If you see one, you can be certain that 40 more live in the area.

raticate1: Its hind feet are webbed. They act as flippers, so it can swim in rivers and hunt for prey.

spearow1: Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around very fast to protect its territory.

fearow1: A Pokémon that dates back many years. If it senses danger, it flies high and away, instantly.

ekans1: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.

arbok1: The frightening patterns on its belly have been studied. Six variations have been confirmed.

pikachu1: Pikachu that can generate powerful electricity have cheek sacs that are extra soft and super stretchy.

pikachu2: When Pikachu meet, they’ll touch their tails together and exchange electricity through them as a form of greeting.

raichu1: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.

raichu2: If its electric pouches run empty, it raises its tail to gather electricity from the atmosphere.

sandshrew1: It loves to bathe in the grit of dry, sandy areas. By sand bathing, the Pokémon rids itself of dirt and moisture clinging to its body.

sandshrew2: It burrows into the ground to create its nest. If hard stones impede its tunneling, it uses its sharp claws to shatter them and then carries on digging.

sandslash1: The drier the area Sandslash lives in, the harder and smoother the Pokémon’s spikes will feel when touched.

sandslash2: It climbs trees by hooking on with its sharp claws. Sandslash shares the berries it gathers, dropping them down to Sandshrew waiting below the tree.

nidoran1: Females are more sensitive to smells than males. While foraging, they’ll use their whiskers to check wind direction and stay downwind of predators.

nidoran2: It uses its hard incisor teeth to crush and eat berries. The tip of a female Nidoran’s horn is a bit more rounded than the tip of a male’s horn.

nidorina1: The horn on its head has atrophied. It’s thought that this happens so Nidorina’s children won’t get poked while their mother is feeding them.

nidorina2: If the group is threatened, these Pokémon will band together to assault enemies with a chorus of ultrasonic waves.

nidoqueen1: Nidoqueen is better at defense than offense. With scales like armor, this Pokémon will shield its children from any kind of attack.

nidoqueen2: It pacifies offspring by placing them in the gaps between the spines on its back. The spines will never secrete poison while young are present.

nidoran1: The horn on a male Nidoran’s forehead contains a powerful poison. This is a very cautious Pokémon, always straining its large ears.

nidoran2: Small but brave, this Pokémon will hold its ground and even risk its life in battle to protect the female it’s friendly with.

nidorino1: With a horn that’s harder than diamond, this Pokémon goes around shattering boulders as it searches for a moon stone.

nidorino2: It’s nervous and quick to act aggressively. The potency of its poison increases along with the level of adrenaline present in its body.

nidoking1: When it goes on a rampage, it’s impossible to control. But in the presence of a Nidoqueen it’s lived with for a long time, Nidoking calms down.

nidoking2: Nidoking prides itself on its strength. It’s forceful and spirited in battle, making use of its thick tail and diamond-crushing horn.

clefairy1: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.

clefairy2: Its adorable behavior and cry make it highly popular. However, this cute Pokémon is rarely found.

clefable1: A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen, it will run and hide the moment it senses people.

clefable2: Their ears are sensitive enough to hear a pin drop from over a mile away, so they’re usually found in quiet places.

vulpix1: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.

vulpix2: As each tail grows, its fur becomes more lustrous. When held, it feels slightly warm.

ninetales1: It is said to live 1,000 years, and each of its tails is loaded with supernatural powers.

ninetales2: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.

jigglypuff1: Jigglypuff has top-notch lung capacity, even by comparison to other Pokémon. It won’t stop singing its lullabies until its foes fall asleep.

jigglypuff2: By freely changing the wavelength of its voice, Jigglypuff sings a mysterious melody sure to make any listener sleepy.

wigglytuff1: The more air it takes in, the more it inflates. If opponents catch it in a bad mood, it will inflate itself to an enormous size to intimidate them.

wigglytuff2: It’s proud of its fur, which is fine and delicate. In particular, the curl on its forehead has a texture that’s perfectly heavenly.

zubat1: It emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check its surroundings. Even in tight caves, Zubat flies around with skill.

zubat2: Zubat live in caves, down where the sun’s light won’t reach. In the morning, they gather together to keep each other warm as they sleep.

golbat1: It loves to drink other creatures’ blood. It’s said that if it finds others of its kind going hungry, it sometimes shares the blood it’s gathered.

golbat2: Its feet are tiny, but this Pokémon walks skillfully. It sneaks up on sleeping prey before sinking in its fangs and slurping up blood.

oddish1: If exposed to moonlight, it starts to move. It roams far and wide at night to scatter its seeds.

oddish2: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.

gloom1: Its pistils exude an incredibly foul odor. The horrid stench can cause fainting at a distance of 1.25 miles.

gloom2: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.

vileplume1: It has the world’s largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen

vileplume2: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

paras1: Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.

parasect1: The bug host is drained of energy by the mushroom on its back. The mushroom appears to do all the thinking.

venonat1: Its large eyes act as radar. In a bright place, you can see that they are clusters of many tiny eyes.

venomoth1: The powdery scales on its wings are hard to remove from skin. They also contain poison that leaks out on contact.

diglett1: If a Diglett digs through a field, it leaves the soil perfectly tilled and ideal for planting crops.

diglett2: It burrows through the ground at a shallow depth. It leaves raised earth in its wake, making it easy to spot.

dugtrio1: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.

dugtrio2: These Diglett triplets dig over 60 miles below sea level. No one knows what it’s like underground.

meowth1: It loves to collect shiny things. If it’s in a good mood, it might even let its Trainer have a look at its hoard of treasures.

meowth2: It washes its face regularly to keep the coin on its forehead spotless. It doesn’t get along with Galarian Meowth.

persian1: Getting this prideful Pokémon to warm up to you takes a lot of effort, and it will claw at you the moment it gets annoyed.

persian2: Its elegant and refined behavior clashes with that of the barbaric Perrserker. The relationship between the two is one of mutual disdain.

psyduck1: Psyduck is constantly beset by headaches. If the Pokémon lets its strange power erupt, apparently the pain subsides for a while.
As Psyduck gets stressed out, its headache gets progressively worse. It uses intense psychic energy to overwhelm those around it.

golduck1: This Pokémon lives in gently flowing rivers. It paddles through the water with its long limbs, putting its graceful swimming skills on display.

golduck2: Old tales tell of Golduck punishing those that defiled its river. The guilty were dragged into the water and taken away.

mankey1: An agile Pokémon that lives in trees. It angers easily and will not hesitate to attack anything.

primeape1: It stops being angry only when nobody else is around. To view this moment is very difficult.

growlithe1: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.

growlithe2: Extremely loyal, it will fearlessly bark at any opponent to protect its own Trainer from harm.

arcanine1: The sight of it running over 6,200 miles in a single day and night has captivated many people.

arcanine2: A Pokémon that has long been admired for its beauty. It runs agilely as if on wings.

poliwag1: For Poliwag, swimming is easier than walking. The swirl pattern on its belly is actually part of the Pokémon’s innards showing through the skin.

poliwag2: In rivers with fast-flowing water, this Pokémon will cling to a rock by using its thick lips, which act like a suction cup.

poliwhirl1: Staring at the swirl on its belly causes drowsiness. This trait of Poliwhirl’s has been used in place of lullabies to get children to go to sleep.

poliwhirl2: This Pokémon’s sweat is a slimy mucus. When captured, Poliwhirl can slither from its enemies’ grasp and escape.

poliwrath1: Its body is solid muscle. When swimming through cold seas, Poliwrath uses its impressive arms to smash through drift ice and plow forward.

poliwrath2: Poliwrath is skilled at both swimming and martial arts. It uses its well-trained arms to dish out powerful punches.

abra1: This Pokémon uses its psychic powers while it sleeps. The contents of Abra’s dreams affect the powers that the Pokémon wields.

abra2: Abra can teleport in its sleep. Apparently the more deeply Abra sleeps, the farther its teleportations go.

kadabra1: Using its psychic power, Kadabra levitates as it sleeps. It uses its springy tail as a pillow.

kadabra2: This Pokémon’s telekinesis is immensely powerful. To prepare for evolution, Kadabra stores up psychic energy in the star on its forehead.

alakazam1: It has an incredibly high level of intelligence. Some say that Alakazam remembers everything that ever happens to it, from birth till death.

alakazam2: Alakazam wields potent psychic powers. It’s said that this Pokémon used these powers to create the spoons it holds.

machop1: Its whole body is composed of muscles. Even though it’s the size of a human child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.

machop2: Always brimming with power, it passes time by lifting boulders. Doing so makes it even stronger.

machoke1: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

machoke2: Its formidable body never gets tired. It helps people by doing work such as the moving of heavy goods.

machamp1: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.

machamp2: With four arms that react more quickly than it can think, it can execute many punches at once.

bellsprout1: Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny bugs with its vines and devours them.

weepinbell1: When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is dissolved by strong acids.

victreebell1: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is dissolved in a day, bones and all.

tentacool1: Tentacool is not a particularly strong swimmer. It drifts across the surface of shallow seas as it searches for prey.

tentacool2: This Pokémon is mostly made of water. A Tentacool out in the ocean is very hard to spot, because its body blends in with the sea.

tentacruel1: When the red orbs on Tentacruel’s head glow brightly, watch out. The Pokémon is about to fire off a burst of ultrasonic waves.

tentacruel2: Its 80 tentacles can stretch and shrink freely. Tentacruel ensnares prey in a net of spread-out tentacles, delivering venomous stings to its catch.

geodude1: Commonly found near mountain trails and the like. If you step on one by accident, it gets angry.

graveler1: Often seen rolling down mountain trails. Obstacles are just things to roll straight over, not avoid.

golem1: Once it sheds its skin, its body turns tender and whitish. Its hide hardens when it’s exposed to air

ponyta1: It can’t run properly when it’s newly born. As it races around with others of its kind, its legs grow stronger.

ponyta2: If you’ve been accepted by Ponyta, its burning mane is mysteriously no longer hot to the touch.

rapidash1: This Pokémon can be seen galloping through fields at speeds of up to 150 mph, its fiery mane fluttering in the wind.

rapidash2: The fastest runner becomes the leader, and it decides the herd’s pace and direction of travel.

slowpoke1: Slow-witted and oblivious, this Pokémon won’t feel any pain if its tail gets eaten. It won’t notice when its tail grows back, either.

slowpoke2: When this Pokémon’s tail is soaked in water, sweetness seeps from it. Slowpoke uses this trait to lure in and fish up other Pokémon.

slowbro1: Slowpoke became Slowbro when a Shellder bit on to its tail. Sweet flavors seeping from the tail make the Shellder feel as if its life is a dream.

slowbro2: Being bitten by a Shellder shocked this Pokémon into standing on two legs. If the Shellder lets go, it seems Slowbro will turn back into a Slowpoke.

magnemite1: At times, Magnemite runs out of electricity and ends up on the ground. If you give batteries to a grounded Magnemite, it’ll start moving again.

magnemite2: It subsists on electricity. As Magnemite flies, it emits electromagnetic waves from the units on each side of its body.

magneton1: This Pokémon is three Magnemite that have linked together. Magneton sends out powerful radio waves to study its surroundings.

magneton2: This Pokémon is constantly putting out a powerful magnetic force. Most computers go haywire when a Magneton approaches.

farfetch'd1: The stalk this Pokémon carries in its wings serves as a sword to cut down opponents. In a dire situation, the stalk can also serve as food.

farfetch'd2: They use a plant stalk as a weapon, but not all of them use it in the same way. Several distinct styles of stalk fighting have been observed.

doduo1: Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.

dodrio1: One of Doduo’s two heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph in prairies.

seel1: Loves freezing-cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit.

dewgong1: Its entire body is a snowy white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.

grimer1: Made of congealed sludge. It smells too putrid to touch. Even weeds won’t grow in its path.

muk1: Smells so awful, it can cause fainting. Through degeneration of its nose, it lost its sense of smell.

shellder1: It swims facing backward by opening and closing its two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.

shellder2: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

cloyster1: Its shell is extremely hard. It cannot be shattered, even with a bomb. The shell opens only when it is attacking.

cloyster2: Once it slams its shell shut, it is impossible to open, even by those with superior strength.

gastly1: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.

gastly2: With its gas-like body, it can sneak into any place it desires. However, it can be blown away by wind.

haunter1: Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim starts shaking constantly until death eventually comes.

haunter2: If you get the feeling of being watched in darkness when nobody is around, Haunter is there.

gengar1: On the night of a full moon, if shadows move on their own and laugh, it must be Gengar’s doing.

gengar2: It is said to emerge from darkness to steal the lives of those who become lost in mountains.

onix1: As it digs through the ground, it absorbs many hard objects. This is what makes its body so solid.

onix2: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.

drowzee1: If you sleep by it all the time, it will sometimes show you dreams it had eaten in the past.

hypno1: Avoid eye contact if you come across one. It will try to put you to sleep by using its pendulum.

krabby1: It can be found near the sea. The large pincers grow back if they are torn out of their sockets.

krabby2: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.

kingler1: Its large and hard pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, being so big, it is unwieldy to move.

kingler2: Its oversized claw is very powerful, but when it’s not in battle, the claw just gets in the way.

voltorb1: It is said to camouflage itself as a Poké Ball. It will self-destruct with very little stimulus.

electrode1: Stores electrical energy inside its body. Even the slightest shock could trigger a huge explosion.

exeggcute1: Though it may look like it’s just a bunch of eggs, it’s a proper Pokémon. Exeggcute communicates with others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.

exeggcute2: These Pokémon get nervous when they’re not in a group of six. The minute even one member of the group goes missing, Exeggcute become cowardly.

exeggutor1: Each of Exeggutor’s three heads is thinking different thoughts. The three don’t seem to be very interested in one another.

exeggutor2: When they work together, Exeggutor’s three heads can put out powerful psychic energy. Cloudy days make this Pokémon sluggish.

cubone1: When the memory of its departed mother brings it to tears, its cries echo mournfully within the skull it wears on its head.

cubone2: This Pokémon wears the skull of its deceased mother. Sometimes Cubone’s dreams make it cry, but each tear Cubone sheds makes it stronger.

marowak1: This Pokémon overcame its sorrow to evolve a sturdy new body. Marowak faces its opponents bravely, using a bone as a weapon.

marowak2: When this Pokémon evolved, the skull of its mother fused to it. Marowak’s temperament also turned vicious at the same time.

hitmonlee1: This amazing Pokémon has an awesome sense of balance. It can kick in succession from any position.

hitmonlee2: The legs freely contract and stretch. The stretchy legs allow it to hit a distant foe with a rising kick.

hitmonchan1: Its punches slice the air. They are launched at such high speed, even a slight graze could cause a burn.

hitmonchan2: Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to need a short break after fighting for three minutes.

lickitung1: If this Pokémon’s sticky saliva gets on you and you don’t clean it off, an intense itch will set in. The itch won’t go away, either.

lickitung2: Bug Pokémon are Lickitung’s main food source. This Pokémon paralyzes its prey with a lick from its long tongue, then swallows the prey whole.

koffing1: Its body is full of poisonous gas. It floats into garbage dumps, seeking out the fumes of raw, rotting trash.

koffing2: It adores polluted air. Some claim that Koffing used to be more plentiful in the Galar region than they are now.

weezing1: It mixes gases between its two bodies. It’s said that these Pokémon were seen all over the Galar region back in the day.

weezing2: It can’t suck in air quite as well as a Galarian Weezing, but the toxins it creates are more potent than those of its counterpart.

rhyhorn1: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging tackles.

rhyhorn2: It can remember only one thing at a time. Once it starts rushing, it forgets why it started.

rhydon1: It begins walking on its hind legs after evolution. It can punch holes through boulders with its horn.

rhydon2: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.

chansey1: The egg Chansey carries is not only delicious but also packed with nutrition. It’s used as a high-class cooking ingredient.

chansey2: This species was once very slow. To protect their eggs from other creatures, these Pokémon became able to flee quickly.

tangela1: Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this Pokémon’s true appearance remains a mystery.

tangela2: The vines of a Tangela have a distinct scent. In some parts of Galar, Tangela vines are used as herbs.

kangaskhan1: Although it’s carrying its baby in a pouch on its belly, Kangaskhan is swift on its feet. It intimidates its opponents with quick jabs.

kangaskhan2: There are records of a lost human child being raised by a childless Kangaskhan.

horsea1: Horsea makes its home in oceans with gentle currents. If this Pokémon is under attack, it spits out pitch-black ink and escapes.

horsea2: They swim with dance-like motions and cause whirlpools to form. Horsea compete to see which of them can generate the biggest whirlpool.

seadra1: It’s the males that raise the offspring. While Seadra are raising young, the spines on their backs secrete thicker and stronger poison.

seadra2: Seadra’s mouth is slender, but its suction power is strong. In an instant, Seadra can suck in food that’s larger than the opening of its mouth.

goldeen1: Its dorsal, pectoral, and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the Water Dancer.

goldeen2: Its dorsal and pectoral fins are strongly developed like muscles. It can swim at a speed of five knots.

seaking1: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.

seaking2: Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed boulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from washing away.

staryu1: If you visit a beach at the end of summer, you’ll be able to see groups of Staryu lighting up in a steady rhythm.

staryu2: Fish Pokémon nibble at it, but Staryu isn’t bothered. Its body regenerates quickly, even if part of it is completely torn off.

starmie1: This Pokémon has an organ known as its core. The organ glows in seven colors when Starmie is unleashing its potent psychic powers.

starmie2: Starmie swims by spinning its body at high speed. As this Pokémon cruises through the ocean, it absorbs tiny plankton.

mr.mime1: The broadness of its hands may be no coincidence—many scientists believe its palms became enlarged specifically for pantomiming.

mr.mime2: It’s known for its top-notch pantomime skills. It protects itself from all sorts of attacks by emitting auras from its fingers to create walls.

scyther1: As Scyther fights more and more battles, its scythes become sharper and sharper. With a single slice, Scyther can fell a massive tree.

scyther2: If you come across an area in a forest where a lot of the trees have been cut down, what you've found is a Scyther's territory.

jynx1: In certain parts of Galar, Jynx was once feared and worshiped as the Queen of Ice.

jynx2: The Jynx of Galar often have beautiful and delicate voices. Some of these Pokémon have even gathered a fan base.

electabuzz1: Many power plants keep Ground-type Pokémon around as a defense against Electabuzz that come seeking electricity.

electabuzz2: With the coming of a storm, many of these Pokémon will gather under tall trees and sit there waiting for lightning to strike.

magmar1: Magmar dispatches its prey with fire. But it regrets this habit once it realizes that it has burned its intended prey to a charred crisp.

magmar2: These Pokémon’s bodies are constantly burning. Magmar are feared as one of the causes behind fires.

pinsir1: These Pokémon judge one another based on pincers. Thicker, more impressive pincers make for more popularity with the opposite gender.

pinsir2: This Pokémon clamps its pincers down on its prey and then either splits the prey in half or flings it away.

tauros1: When Tauros begins whipping itself with its tails, it’s a warning that the Pokémon is about to charge with astounding speed.

tauros2: The Tauros of the Galar region are volatile in nature, and they won’t allow people to ride on their backs.

magikarp1: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the most weak and pathetic Pokémon in the world.

magikarp2: This weak and pathetic Pokémon gets easily pushed along rivers when there are strong currents.

gyarados1: It has an extremely aggressive nature. The Hyper Beam it shoots from its mouth totally incinerates all targets.

gyarados2: Once it begins to rampage, a Gyarados will burn everything down, even in a harsh storm.

lapras1: A smart and kindhearted Pokémon, it glides across the surface of the sea while its beautiful song echoes around it.

lapras2: Crossing icy seas is no issue for this cold-resistant Pokémon. Its smooth skin is a little cool to the touch.

ditto1: It can reconstitute its entire cellular structure to change into what it sees, but it returns to normal when it relaxes.

ditto2: When it encounters another Ditto, it will move faster than normal to duplicate that opponent exactly.

eevee1: It has the ability to alter the composition of its body to suit its surrounding environment.

eevee2: Thanks to its unstable genetic makeup, this special Pokémon conceals many different possible evolutions.

vaporeaon1: When Vaporeon’s fins begin to vibrate, it is a sign that rain will come within a few hours.

vaporeaon2: Its body’s cellular structure is similar to the molecular composition of water. It can melt invisibly in water.

jolteon1: If it is angered or startled, the fur all over its body bristles like sharp needles that pierce foes.

jolteon2: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10,000-volt lightning bolts.

flareon1: Once it has stored up enough heat, this Pokémon’s body temperature can reach up to 1,700 degrees Fahrenheit.

flareon2: It stores some of the air it inhales in its internal flame pouch, which heats it to over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.

porygon1: State-of-the-art technology was used to create Porygon. It was the first artificial Pokémon to be created via computer programming.

porygon2: In recent years, this species has been very helpful in cyberspace. These Pokémon will go around checking to make sure no suspicious data exists.

omanyte1: Because some Omanyte manage to escape after being restored or are released into the wild by people, this species is becoming a problem.

omanyte2: This Pokémon is a member of an ancient, extinct species. Omanyte paddles through water with its 10 tentacles, looking like it’s just drifting along.

omastar1: Weighed down by a large and heavy shell, Omastar couldn’t move very fast. Some say it went extinct because it was unable to catch food.

omastar2: Omastar’s sharp fangs could crush rock, but the Pokémon can attack only the prey that come within reach of its tentacles.

kabuto1: This species is almost entirely extinct. Kabuto molt every three days, making their shells harder and harder.

kabuto2: While some say this species has gone extinct, Kabuto sightings are apparently fairly common in some places.

kabutops1: Kabutops slices its prey apart and sucks out the fluids. The discarded body parts become food for other Pokémon.

kabutops2: The cause behind the extinction of this species is unknown. Kabutops were aggressive Pokémon that inhabited warm seas.

aerodactyl1: This is a ferocious Pokémon from ancient times. Apparently even modern technology is incapable of producing a perfectly restored specimen.

aerodactyl2: Aerodactyl’s sawlike fangs can shred skin to tatters—even the skin of Steel-type Pokémon.

snorlax1: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.

snorlax2: This Pokémon’s stomach is so strong, even eating moldy or rotten food will not affect it.

articuno1: It’s said that this Pokémon’s beautiful blue wings are made of ice. Articuno flies over snowy mountains, its long tail fluttering along behind it.

articuno2: This Pokémon can control ice at will. Articuno is said to live in snowy mountains riddled with permafrost.

zapdos1: This Pokémon has complete control over electricity. There are tales of Zapdos nesting in the dark depths of pitch-black thunderclouds.

zapdos2: Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon. It’s said that when Zapdos rubs its feathers together, lightning will fall immediately after.

moltres1: It’s one of the legendary bird Pokémon. When Moltres flaps its flaming wings, they glimmer with a dazzling red glow.

moltres2: There are stories of this Pokémon using its radiant, flame-cloaked wings to light up paths for those lost in the mountains.

dratini1: Dratini dwells near bodies of rapidly flowing water, such as the plunge pools of waterfalls. As it grows, Dratini will shed its skin many times.

dratini2: This Pokémon was long considered to be no more than a myth. The small lump on a Dratini’s forehead is actually a horn that’s still coming in.

dragonair1: This Pokémon lives in pristine oceans and lakes. It can control the weather, and it uses this power to fly into the sky, riding on the wind.

dragonair2: This Pokémon gathers power in the orbs on its tail and controls the weather. When enshrouded by an aura, Dragonair has a mystical appearance.

dragonite1: It’s a kindhearted Pokémon. If it spots a drowning person or Pokémon, Dragonite simply must help them.

dragonite2: This Pokémon is known as the Sea Incarnate. Figureheads that resemble Dragonite decorate the bows of many ships.

mewtwo1: Its DNA is almost the same as Mew’s. However, its size and disposition are vastly different.

mewtwo2: Its DNA is almost the same as Mew’s. However, its size and disposition are vastly different.

mew1: When viewed through a microscope, this Pokémon’s short, fine, delicate hair can be seen.
